page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: Homes in the area are predominantly owner-occupied.There is a small area of modern council houses built on the site of Hamstead Colliery. A noticeable aspect concerning the houses in the area is that few have been built with garages,necessitating parking on the roads.Only the larger houses along the main roads have garages constructed with the house.The Perry Beeches Estate,built by the First National Housing Trust in the 1930's is of red brick;the houses provide two and three bedroomed accommodation for families;the houses were built for 250 pounds and are now selling at 18,000 pounds. Young families are moving into the area but many homes are still occupied by single,elderly persons. A general impression of well-kept houses and gardens prevails.
